com.stormpath.shiro.realm

Class ApplicationRealm

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.shiro.realm.CachingRealm
      • org.apache.shiro.realm.AuthenticatingRealm
        • org.apache.shiro.realm.AuthorizingRealm
          • com.stormpath.shiro.realm.ApplicationRealm
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.apache.shiro.authc.LogoutAware, org.apache.shiro.authz.Authorizer, org.apache.shiro.authz.permission.PermissionResolverAware, org.apache.shiro.authz.permission.RolePermissionResolverAware, org.apache.shiro.cache.CacheManagerAware, org.apache.shiro.realm.Realm, org.apache.shiro.util.Initializable, org.apache.shiro.util.Nameable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    PassthroughApplicationRealm

    public class ApplicationRealm
extends org.apache.shiro.realm.AuthorizingRealm
    A Realm implementation that uses the Stormpath Cloud Identity Management service for authentication and authorization operations for a single Application.

    Your application's Stormpath REST URL must be configured as the applicationRestUrl property.

    Authentication

    Once your application's REST URL is configured, this realm implementation automatically executes authentication attempts without any need of further configuration by interacting with the Application's loginAttempts endpoint.

    Authorization

    Stormpath Accounts and Groups can be translated to Shiro roles and permissions via the following components:
    • AccountPermissionResolver
    • GroupPermissionResolver
    • GroupRoleResolver
    • AccountRoleResolver

    This realm implementation comes pre-configured with the following default implementations, which should suit most Shiro+Stormpath use cases:

    Property Pre-configured Implementation Notes
    groupRoleResolver DefaultGroupRoleResolver Each Stormpath Group can be represented as up to three possible Shiro roles (with 1-to-1 being the default). See the DefaultGroupRoleResolver JavaDoc for more info.
    accountRoleResolver None Most Shiro+Stormpath applications should only need the above DefaultGroupRoleResolver when using Stormpath Groups as Shiro roles. This realm implementation already acquires the account's assigned groups and resolves the group roles via the above groupRoleResolver. You only need to configure this property if you need an additional way to represent an account's assigned roles that cannot already be represented via Stormpath account <--> group associations.
    groupPermissionResolver GroupCustomDataPermissionResolver The GroupCustomDataPermissionResolver assumes the convention that a Group's assigned permissions are stored as a nested Set&lt;String&gt; field in the group's CustomData resource. See the GroupCustomDataPermissionResolver JavaDoc for more information.
    accountPermissionResolver AccountCustomDataPermissionResolver The AccountCustomDataPermissionResolver assumes the convention that an Account's directly assigned permissions are stored as a nested Set&lt;String&gt; field in the account's CustomData resource. See the AccountCustomDataPermissionResolver JavaDoc for more information.

    Transitive Permissions

    This implementation represents an Account's granted permissions as all permissions that:
    1. Are assigned directly to the Account itself
    2. Are assigned to any of the Account's assigned Groups

    Assigning Permissions

    A Shiro Realm is a read-only component - it typically does not support account/group/permission updates directly. Therefore, you make modifications to these components by interacting with the data store (e.g. Stormpath) directly.

    The CustomDataPermissionsEditor has been provided for this purpose. For example, assuming the convention of storing permissions in an account or group's CustomData resource: 

     Account account = getAccount();
 new CustomDataPermissionsEditor(account.getCustomData())
     .append("someResourceType:anIdentifier:anAction")
     .append("anotherResourceType:anIdentifier:*")
     .remove("oldPermission");
 account.save();
    Again, the default groupPermissionResolver and accountPermissionResolver instances assume this CustomData storage strategy, so if you use them, the above CustomDataPermissionsEditor will work easily.
    Since:
    0.1
    See Also:
    AccountPermissionResolver, GroupPermissionResolver, GroupRoleResolver, AccountRoleResolver

      • getApplicationRestUrl

        public String getApplicationRestUrl()
        Returns the Stormpath REST URL of the specific application communicating with Stormpath.

        Any application supported by Stormpath will have a dedicated unique REST URL. The Stormpath REST URL of the Shiro-enabled application communicating with Stormpath via this Realm must be configured by this property.

        Returns:
        the Stormpath REST URL of the specific application communicating with Stormpath.

      • getAccountRoleResolver

        public AccountRoleResolver getAccountRoleResolver()
        Returns the AccountRoleResolver used to resolve a Stormpath Account into Shiro role names. This is null by default.

        You only need to configure this property if you are not using Stormpath Groups as Shiro Roles.
        Stormpath Account resources are usually associated with one or more Stormpath Groups and those Groups can be represented as Shiro roles by using the groupRoleResolver. You only need this component to represent Account Roles that are not already represented as Stormpath Groups via the groupRoleResolver.

        Returns:
        the AccountRoleResolver used to resolve a Stormpath Account into Shiro role names.
        Since:
        0.2

      • setAccountRoleResolver

        public void setAccountRoleResolver(AccountRoleResolver accountRoleResolver)
        Sets the AccountRoleResolver used to resolve a Stormpath Account into Shiro role names. This is null by default.

        You only need to configure this property if you are not using Stormpath Groups as Shiro Roles.
        Stormpath Account resources are usually associated with one or more Stormpath Groups and those Groups can be represented as Shiro roles by using the groupRoleResolver. You only need this component to represent Account Roles that are not already represented as Stormpath Groups via the groupRoleResolver.

        Parameters:
        accountRoleResolver - the AccountRoleResolver used to resolve a Stormpath Account into Shiro role names.
        Since:
        0.2

      • getAuthenticationCacheKey

        protected Object getAuthenticationCacheKey(org.apache.shiro.subject.PrincipalCollection principals)
        If authentication caching is enabled, authentication data for an account must be evicted (removed) from the cached during logout.

        Since the user submitted username is different to the the primary account identifier (i.e. username for the former, account href for the latter), we need to overwrite the AuthenticatingRealm#getAuthenticationCacheKey(PrincipalCollection).

        This guarantees that the same cache key used to cache the data during authentication (derived from the AuthenticationToken) will be used to remove the cached data during logout (derived from the PrincipalCollection).

        This is a fix for Issue #6.

        Overrides:
        getAuthenticationCacheKey in class org.apache.shiro.realm.AuthenticatingRealm
        Parameters:
        principals - the collection of all principals associated with the current subject.
        Returns:
        the key used to store the authentication information in the cache (i.e. Stormpath's Account email)
        Since:
        0.6.0
